description: Two large bears stand near a tree, observing two humans enjoying a picnic with a guitar and book. One bear gestures emphatically, questioning why their impressive fangs and sharp claws imply a diet restricted to mere honey and berries. This dialogue creates irony, juxtaposing the common perception of bears with the bear's self-awareness of its predatory physiology. The scene is absurd, depicting wild animals engaged in a human-like discussion about dietary destiny. The bear's argument implicitly points towards the humans as a potential alternative food source, adding a layer of dark humor.
caption: "C'mon! Look at these fangs! Look at these claws! You think we're supposed to eat just honey and berries?"
